intro: Gnidia phaeotricha, commonly known as the yellow stinkwood, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several small, flat seeds. The plant is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is adapted to dry conditions.
